content.description: This is a cool, upside down traverse around the RV lounge. Start at the west corner column, cross over top beam, and shimmy to the southeast corner. You can either top at the light or elongate it all the way around the corner.
content.protection: It is a buildering problem, just a pad will do.
content.location: This is in the RVs by Lot 5. You'll see the obvious stone pillars leading to metal beams.

content.description:
This is a fun chimney, kinda small and thin on one side but doable.

A fun variation to this route is starting on the door with your hand on the inside of the crack, and you go up to the ledge and into the chimney from there to make it a little harder.
content.location: This is on the side of the Field House next to the Clarke Field. You'll see the entry, then about 10 feet to the right is this problem.

content.description: The crux on this route is the move from the upside down bar to over the railing. The wire in the railing bends pretty easily, so watch your fingers in there. This is super fun though and easily a classic.
content.protection: This is a highball buildering problem, a crash pad does just fine.
content.location: This route is on the backside of Peter Claver Hall, on the northern most side of campus. You'll see the stairwell in a big corner of the building.

pathTokens: Denver Metropolitan Area Bouldering and Buildering
